column4: Guys ... I want to understand something .... why isn't the universe and multiverse installed by default ??
hum ....
because they contain software that is not absolutely open source
sure ... but ... Why don't you guys at least make it clear on the "Add Applications" ?
so people can know they have some missing packs ..
they start to get into legal waters, waters they would just as soon avoid

I wanted to install gmail-notify and took a long time to figure out how to do it via apt-get . Like me, there are lots of users that don't know what do do after searching a packet and not finding it ...
Maybe not include by default, but a warning there should be useful ...
yeah  - all time "nothing found"
but now I installed via apt-get
after enabling the repositories...
strange them ... O.o
ok .. wait a bit Orbin ...
Orbin : yeah, it's there ...
Orbin : Even though, I think that a warning at the first open or when not finding a package at "search" using the "Add packages" would be useful to newcomers ...
Orbin : you agree ?
Orbin : Great ! :) So, how can we put this on hands of developers, to add on the next release ?
I'm a newcomer to linux ... I'm impressed on how things got more user-friendly in Ubuntu!
A dev channel ? maybe #ubuntu-dev ?
tritium : googling for "malone" ...
orbit : here ! https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+filebug
where to report a bug, I'm going to fill it.
launchpad.net
